column1: short of length on middle and leg, jumps and blocks
short, shapes away, slashes hard at it and sends it soaring over backward point
back of a length on middle, blocked to mid-on with a straight bat
back of a length, slight shape away towards off, defended
leg-side lines, tucked through square leg
fullish on middle, chipped to the left of mid-on
full, some swing away outside off, blocked into the surface
full, angling in, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off, defended to point
length, slightly shapes away, left alone outside off
short of length, blocked to cover
very full, swinging away, pushed out to cover
length, seams away, blocked to cover
back of a length, tucked off the pads to square leg
fullish length on middle, pushed back
full toss that dips and clips the pad as it rolls away into the leg side, missing leg with that angle
back of a length, blocked into the covers
full toss, angles into him, and he chips it in the air between mid-on and midwicket to get off the mark
full, swings away, covers the line and hammers it through the covers

huge shout for leg before, not given Inside edge? Height? Seemed close. Short of length, cuts in off the deck and hits the front pad high. Yup, quite high. Replays show would have clipped the top of the stumps
gets on top of the bounce and blocks to cover
tries to pull with no room and gets a top edge that barely carries any substantial distance, just drops past the umpire
back of a length, punched past point diving to his left
lets a short one go outside off
full, nipping away, driven to cover
awkwardly gets on top of a short one and fends it away to point
back of a length, a little low, waits and scythes to cover
short one down the leg side
past a diving third man. Shahzad upper cuts a short one, just a ramp over the keeper and Dhananjaya sprints to his left and dives in front but can't get a hand to it
just short of third man again. Shahzad arches back and ramps this over and this time Dhananjaya has to run forward but the ball drops short
now it goes through the slips, past the first slip fielder as he opens the face late. Third man can't get around it
swings and misses at an away-nipper
full on middle and leg, blocked down the pitch
short, backs away and tries to ramp it over. Misses
back of a length, punched to cover
short and over middle and leg as he misses with the pull
arches out of the way of a short one
short of slip, bounces to his left as the batsman drives away from the body
full around off, leans into a drive through the covers as this time the movement is minimal
slight shape outside off, left alone
hangs the bat loosely outside off to get beaten
fields off his own bowling with the right hand outstretched and throws it back at the stumps, Misses it.. as well as the body
length around off, plants the front foot across and punches to cover
pitched up outside off, pushed back
spins into him as he forces a cut to point
advances and turns it away to the right of midwicket
clipped with the turn to square leg
flighted around off, driven to long-on
fetches a sweep from outside off to deep midwicket
short of length, punched to cover
now he finds the gap between cover and point as he carves it away with an open face
short, fetches a pull from outside off through deep midwicket
tries to cut but it nips away leaving him beaten
short of length, backs away and punches to cover
back of a length on middle, shifts back and tucks through midwicket
length, spinning in, whipped to deep midwicket
short wide, cut to cover
back of a length, keeps low, punched to extra cover
spins in from off, backs away and punches to mid-off
fires it wide outside off, well outside the batsman's reach
goes too hard at a pull and with no room, drags it to the bowler
front-foot defence to the bowler
short of a length, tucked to square leg
shortish around off, slapped square of third man
shortish, angled in, turned around to fine leg
short, well over leg stump
shortish again, acceptable height, ducked under
direct hit and he was gone.. by miles. Start, stop. Start, stop, after Shahzad misses a flick and the ball rolls into the leg side off the pad
angled in, goes off the pad to the keeper
skips down leg as he tries to sweep
advances, meets the pitch, and gives himself enough free space to spank it over long-off
length, spins in, punched back
back of a length, non-turning, cut to point

that's a loose shot. Error in judgement from Shahzad as he tries to reverse sweep a length ball from a middle and leg line. Always minimal chance of making contact from there. Rapped on the pad and pretty plumb
googly, spins into middle, defended back
advances and closes the face to get a leading edge that gets past first slip's right
short of length, left alone outside off
short of length, leans forward and punches to cover
short of length, blocked down the pitch
short, angled in, rocks back and pulls to deep backward square
short of length on off, opens the face to third man
shuffles to cover off-stump and blocks
pitched up outside off, defended to cover
short of length, shifts back and blocks
full outside off, driven back
pitched up on leg, clipped to midwicket
length, spins in, punched to long-on
drills a full toss straight back
length on middle, presents the full face of the bat to punch it straight down. Not quite enough in it to carry to the boundary
angled into the pads, tucked to midwicket
short of length outside off, shuffles across and blocks
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
clipped off the pads to square leg
back of a length, tucked off the pads through square leg
floated up across off, drilled to long-off
driven to extra cover
driven to long-off
tucks a length ball through square leg
full around off, drilled to long-off
good length ball on middle, keeps it out
huge lbw appeal but umpire Brathwaite shakes his head, possibly because the Ihsanullah was well down the pitch. And the impact is above the flap of the pad too. Otherwise, it was plumb
tries to force it through cover with a back of a length ball outside off. But it holds in the pitch and he mistimes the shot back down the pitch
nudges through midwicket off the back foot
opens the face to find the gap to the left of point, but the fielder moves quickly across to deny the single
goes round the wicket, pitching an offbreak right up there on off stump. Ihsanullah drives to long-off
blocks a very full delivery outside off and forces it to long-off
whips it to the right of the bowler, de Silva dives across to get a hand to it, deflecting it to the left of long-on. Afghanistan use that chaos to pinch a second run
tucks it to one of two short midwickets - signs of a slow pitch. The captain is expecting flick shots to pop up for catches
hits carefully along the ground for a single to deep square leg
the ball is rather full on middle stump, but because of the slow nature of the pitch, Rahmat is more than happy to slink back in his crease and flick it to deep square leg
forcefully hits to short midwicket. Thisara's not giving enough room to free the arms
that's majestic! He walks down the pitch, and even though he is hitting the ball on the up, he rises to his full height to get on top of the ball and launches it down the ground
bouncer from the fast bowler - and a quick one too - Ihsanullah is a tough slow on the hook and gets beaten
clips it off his hips to short midwicket
another short ball - but this time Ihsanullah makes solid contact with his pull shot and the ball skittles away to the square leg boundary. Outstanding hitting
drags it from outside off, but makes sure to roll his wrists on the ball to keep his pull shot down
flighted delivery outside off, serenely hit to long-off
goes back seeing the flatter trajectory, but it with not turning even an inch, he ends up being too far away from the ball to time it properly. Bunt to cover
loops it up on off stump, he sends it back to Jayasuriya
leaps to his right to stop a gently push towards mid-on. Almost manages it. Excellent effort nevertheless
shimmies down the pitch to drive to long-on
inside edge onto pad with Rahmat driving on the up and presenting a very alluring gap between bat and pad.
lovely strangle from the fast bowler, targeting the top of off. Better defensive skills from Rahmat as well
deflects a ball meat to take the off stump over to mid-on
goes for the bouncer, but it gains way too much height.
he knows Malinga's only here to break the partnership, so he's careful in dealing with these wicket-to-wicket deliveries
eases his weight onto the back foot and pulls the short ball off his chest and down to long leg.
bangs it into the pitch again, forcing Ihsanullah to get up off his toes to blunt it
he's getting the ball to skid through, low, but not slip. Rahmat is set up to smash a short ball through to long-off. But ends up mistiming it because of the lack of bounce
nudges it to long-on
pushes him back with a flat trajectory and makes him block in front of off stump
punches to a wide mid-on
full on off stump, he pokes it back at the bowler
the perfect front-foot block on off stump to end the over, and a very rapid over at that
good length on middle, defends
backs away seeing a short ball on off stump and clatters it straight to cover
appeal for lbw but umpire Brathwaite shakes his head. Sliding down, perhaps. Rahmat is beaten by turn and the ball - nicely flighted on middle - turns to strike him low on the pad
clears the front leg and whacks a length ball on middle out to long-on
stands tall and drills it to long-on
seems like the googly, and the batsman just about knocks it down to the wide mid-on
full on off stump, blocks
comes down the track, turning a good length ball into a full toss, and slices it to cover.
fires it into the thigh pad and gives away an easy boundary. Ihsanullah has to do is get the teensiest bit of bat on it. Pressure release.
steps out of his crease and is lucky to put bat to a ball that keeps holding its line outside off. Single behind point
walks across and drags a short delivery outside off to deep midwicket
taps it to long-on
loops it up on middle and leg, Ihsanullah goes for the sweep, doesn't connect, and Kusal does well not to let the ball through
lunges forward to the pitch of the offbreak on off stump and smothers it
legbreak on middle, he clips it to square leg
full on off stump, pushes to cover

another legbreak, he's playing a sweep, right across the line and against the turn, and is struck in front of middle. Umpire Brathwaite shuts down the appeal. But Sri Lanka are reviewing this. UltraEdge says no bat involved. So as long as this good length ball pitches in line with the stumps, Ihsanullah should be out. Yep. Three reds and Akila has another wicket
full and outside off - legbreak by the way - drives to long-off
neatly taps the flighted delivery on middle to long-on
leans into the tossed up delivery outside off and ticks it over to mid-on
steps out to a drifter outside off and does well to ease it through the covers. If Jayasuriya had been able to get the ball to weave a little further away from the bat, he could have had a stumping
full on off stump, nudges it to mid-on
defends to midwicket looking for a single, but it's not there. Now the two batsmen come across for a chat
very full outside off, he dinks to cover

huge appeal for lbw and umpire Ahsan Raza gives it out. Two wickets in two overs for Sri Lanka and both the result of batsmen being bamboozled by spin. Here Asghar is just a touch slow to react to a slider that pins him in front of middle before he's ready to play a shot. Worse, that shot is a flick, with the bat coming around his front pad, which always takes too much time
lunges forward to push into the covers
uses the depth of the crease very nicely and flicks the flatter delivery on middle to midwicket
goes around the wicket to the left-hander and gets the offbreak to pitch on middle and leg. Shahidi defends
forces a full delivery on off stump past the right of the bowler
picks the legbreak as he goes back, clearing the front leg and punching to wide mid-on
gets to the pitch of this one outside off and drives to long-on
hammers it through the gap in the covers. Excellent footwork to get himself leg side of the ball, gifting himself the room he needs to take advantage of a short ball
nudges to long-on
full on middle, from round the wicket, Shahidi defends
keeps his front leg away so he can drive a very full delivery on middle away to long-off
good length on off stump, hits to long-off
pushes towards midwicket
gets on top of this short ball outside off and taps it smartly to cover
flicks it sweetly off his pads! Picks the line so early and stays perfectly balanced as he hits the gap to the right of midwicket. Fine shot
chops it to sweeper cover.

outside edge but with Shahidi playing with soft hands, the ball does down and well wide of the slip fielder. Usman Khan yesterday spoke about getting reverse swing around this time of the innings. Wonder if Chameera can get some too...
controls the short ball well, taking it from outside off, rolling his wrists to send it scurrying to deep square leg
he's a little slow to get on the front foot and ends up making contact with the full length ball going across him while on the move
works it to the left of wide mid-on, but the fielder cuts across to it in time
full and drifting across the right-hander from round the wicket. Rahmat drives to cover
whips it to the right of wide mid-on - and that means it's bisecting deep midwicket and long-on as well. Excellent placement from Rahmat
another little clip off the pads to deep midwicket
shapes to cut the ball off the stumps and could easily have been bowled
quicker and fuller on off stump, Shahidi blocks it
cuts the short and wide delivery to the sweeper
opens the face as he tries to make use of Chameera's pace, but he can't find the gap at point

flays at the ball once he gets a little bit of width outside off and he might get himself a boundary for his trouble. Shehan Jayasuriya is out there on the third man boundary, putting in a dive. But the ball does roll back onto the advertising triangles
hangs back and lets the short ball glide off the face of the bat to deep third man
inside edge onto the body as he tries to deal with a short ball on middle stump
turns a back of a length delivery from outside off to midwicket
full and outside off, he drives to extra cover
dabs the ball between point and cover - does so using soft hands just so he can get the single. Good work
goes deep in his crease to work a flatter delivery on off stump to the right of midwicket. Direct hit at the bowler's end, but Rahmat is safe.
run-out chance with Shahidi hesitating after slicing a good length ball on middle to point. But he recovers in time to make his ground at the non-strikers' end
steps out of his crease to loft a length ball on off stump to long-off
nudges the fuller delivery on off stump to long-on
sweeps a fuller one through square leg
spins in from a length, cut through the gap at covers
appeal for leg before as he strides forward to block. Inside edge
full on off, blocked
pushes away from the body to sweeper cover
short of a length, backs away and punches to cover
slides a fuller one in that's pushed back off the inside of the bat
full on middle, pushed straight back
advances to punch a length ball to sweeper cover
full on middle and leg, clipped through square leg
skips down the track and pushes to long-on
short of a length on leg stump, turns it away to midwicket
length on middle, pushed down the pitch and they risk a single. Direct hit at the keeper's end. He's made his ground comfortably
short outside off, just enough room for a pick-up shot over mid-on. One-bounce over the ropes, and that's fiftty for Rahmat
defended to wide mid-on
full outside off, driven through the covers
punched away to sweeper cover
short, sits up well for him to arch back and ramp it over the keeper
full down the leg side
almost a yorker outside off, drilled out through the covers
full on middle and off, clipped through square leg
full on leg stumps, clipped behind square
full on middle and off, driven to mid-off
driven with open face to backward point
full on middle and leg, driven to long-on
shifts back to a length ball and tucks through square leg
short of length, punched down the ground
gets down to slog but doesn't time it well. One-bounce to mid-on
full on middle, driven to midwicket
full on middle and leg, clipped one-bounce to deep midwicket
yorker on middle, dug out to midwicket
dropped. A pick-up shot, with the angle, to a length ball. Carries to deep midwicket, where Shanaka runs forward and dives but lets it spill out. Malinga drops to his knees after seeing it
full on middle, driven to extra cover
length ball, pushed back
full outside off, pushed to wide long-on
short of a length, turned away to deep backward square leg
shortish on off, jumps back and blocks
opens the face to steer to third man
short of a length on off, defended
full on middle and leg, drilled towards mid-on
short of a length, backs away and slaps to the right of sweeper cover
full on leg stump, clipped to fine leg
short outside off, opens up and cuts to sweeper cover
misses a flick and gets hit on the pad
length, spins in, defended back
flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked to mid-on
full on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
short of length outside off, opens the face to third man
short, barely ducks as it bounces steeply
back of a length outside off, punched through cover
short, cuts into him, pulled to deep backward square leg who gets around it and lets it go because he can't get low enough. Clumsy
short, swivels and pulls to deep square leg
chipped straight over and Thisara Perera snaffles it at long-on. Back of a length, backs away and just helps it over. Thisara moves to his left and grabs it reverse-cupped
short of a length, lobs into the on side off the pad
full outside off, carted over the in-field to sweeper cover
fullish length on middle, flicked off the pads to deep midwicket
short of length outside off, reaches out and chops to point
length outside off, punched to cover
tries to come down the track and clip it. Misses and hits the pad
clipped straight to square leg for a rapid single
back of a length, straightens outside off, punched off the backfoot to long-on
tries to come down the ground and flick and wears it on the pad
leg side length all, tucked away to backward square leg
full outside off, driven to long-on
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
short ball, gets a top-edge on the pull through the vacant square leg region
slower ball, looks to go through extra cover with a drive but gets an inside edge to midwicket
slower length ball on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short ball, tucked up as he tries to pull, gets a top-edge to the vacant fine leg region
closes the face to a leg-side length ball and gets a leading edge to cover
advances to make room and cuts a short one to sweeper cover
leg stump goes cartwheeling. Swipes with no room for a pull, goes right past the bottom of the bat and from close to the back thigh to smash into the stumps
length, flicked off the pads to deep square leg
length ball, punched to cover
length ball on middle and leg, taps it to midwicket
shortish, angled across, slashes through cover
full outside off, driven to cover
shortish, punched to short cover, and the non-striker takes off. Direct hit, and has he been felled here? Looks in trouble. Nope, just in
short ball, backs away and pulls to deep square leg
backs away early and the bowler follows him with a fuller one that's tapped to covers
slaps it over long-off, not the best timing but it's enough to carry just over the boundary. Backs away but still doesn't find enough room. Good enough, though
steers a length ball late through backward point
just short of deep midwicket. Doesn't get hold of a pull.. Akila runs forward and dives and the ball lands just in front. Top effort

chips this harmlessly straight over. Has to fetch it from outside off and swipes without getting into any decent position. Thisara runs to his left at long-on and snaffls it reverse-cupped. Just sticks in his right hand, so a one-handed grab essentially
fullish on leg stump, pushed back
full, angled across, pushed to mid-off and takes off for a single. Direct hit at the non-striker's end but he's made his ground
flicks a length ball from outside off to midwicket
short of a length, sits up nicely outside off but no pace, pulled to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, heaved powerfully to deep midwicket. One-bounce to the fielder
full outside off, driven to long-on
slower length ball, pulled straight to square leg
full, dipping outside off, pitches just in the right area to not allow him to effectively drill it away, off the inside edge onto the stumps
full outside off, driven to extra cover for a very quick run. Gets an extra run via overthrow
very full on off, clipped to square leg who dives to his left
full, angled into the pads, clipped ver fine with a gentle flick of the wrists
miscues a lofted drive over the in-field but lands between cover running back and third man running across
short of good length, not much pace, but he musters up enough to smack it over square leg
shortish outside off, throws his bat at it and gets an outside edge to third man
slower full ball, taps to midwicket for one
tame! Looks for a yorker and bowls a low full toss outside off that's whipped straight to square leg where Akila snaffles a smart low catch
full outside off, hangs back and waits before thumping it miles over long-on. 250 in sight now
full toss outside off, drags it wide of long-on
through the legs. An inch-perfect yorker, he opens u his stance looking to go over the leg side. But the ball dips considerably, skips under the bat, brushes the pad and crashes into the stumps
attempts a reverse swat but it's too full outside off and he makes no contact
five for Thisara. Goes for a reverse glide but this is another yorker and it gets under the bat and smashes into the stumps
flat length ball, defended off the front foot

shout for leg before, given. Impact seemed outside off but Kusal's walking off. Took a big stride forward, it curves in as it travels through the air and then spins in to beat the inside edge with Kusal trying to flick. Struck in front of middle and off. Two games, two ducks for Mendis. HawkEye confirms the impact was in line with off stump and clipping leg
tosses it up on middle, he stretches forward to block
zips through to hit the pad in line with leg side - the new ball is helping Mujeeb spin at pace
full and moving into the right-hander - he seems to deliver these like carrom balls, with the seam upright and angled into batsman and incredibly it swings -  de Silva blocks
back of a length and outside off, Tharanga leaves and then gestures that this new ball is swinging
lets another good length ball angled across him go outside off
on the pads and Tharanga accepts the gift, glancing it away to the boundary. Tharanga's skill through the off side is the stuff of tragicomic legend. Ain't too bad on the legs either
full on off stump, defends

beats him with a peach, The new ball looks quite dangerous under lights. And perhaps that little bit of grass is helping too. The seam can sit in the pitch and dart past the outside edge, even at a shortish length
length ball, outside off, leaves.
more inswing from Mujeeb, but de Silva is able to handle it quite well, taking an open stance, allowing himself to play with a straight bat. Single to long-on
cuts back in and Tharanga has no clue about it. It's only at the last second does he realise he needs to defend it and gets an inside edge
full on off stump, defends
quicker and fuller on leg stump, Tharanga takes the opportunity to get off strike with a flick towards mid-on
outrageous stuff! This is Afghanistan's strike-bowler - an unorthodox menace - and de Silva charges down the pitch and belts him over the covers like a boss
fullish on off stump, defends
squares him up with a ball that pitches outside leg and ends up outside off. Tharanga gets a leading edge to point. Good thing the opener plays with soft hands
looks for the magic ball again, but there's not enough movement, meaning this short ball on leg stump it whipped to long leg
plays and misses as Tharanga's hands follow a short ball outside off. The feet, however, stubbornly stay put
blocks behind point and hares off strike - and it's a risky run too. Direct hit from Rashid at the strikers' end could have been interesting
strikes him on the thigh as de Silva is caught in his crease, playing towards midwicket
sharp movement into the bat, but with the length being short, de Silva has the time to adjust to it. Firm push to mid-off
full on off stump, from round the wicket, Tharanga defends
the shortish length allows Tharanga to play the ball turning into him off the pitch. Neat little clip to midwicket
appears to be a googly, which de Silva defends confidently
shimmies down the pitch - reading the tossed up delivery early and getting to the pitch of it at leg stump - for a single to long-on.
closes the face a touch early and gets a little edge to third man. Mujeeb manages to confuse the batsman by reducing his inswing

ripper! He gets the full ball to hold its line. And considering he's bowling it from round the wicket, the left-hander invariably ends up playing towards midwicket and has a high chance of getting beaten - like this - or getting a leading edge
walks at the medium pacer and attempts a punch through the covers, but he has to settle for an outside edge flying past the right of first slip
whips it off his pads but he'll be disappointed he's not hit the gap at midwicket. That was a half volley on middle

cuts him in half! This is insane from Afghanistan. Under lights, on a grassy pitch, Aftab is bowling unplayables. This one is pitched out, on off stump, de Silva is stuck in the crease, poking away from his body, leaving a big gap and is done in by the inswing
full on off stump, blocks
keeps out a length ball on middle and off
more movement into the right-hander and de Silva is beaten on the inside edge as he tries a flick.
full and angled into middle and leg, Tharanga flicks it through midwicket
steps out of his crease to get to the pitch of the googly outside off and drive to cover
too much swing on this occasion, beating de Silva's flick, and the keeper's grab down the leg side as well
goes quicker and flatter on off stump, Tharanga backs away and punches to cover
another short ball on middle and leg, he hacks it to midwicket
appeal for lbw but umpire Raza says no, probably because it might be heading down leg. Skidder from Mujeeb, striking Tharanga on the front pad even before he comes down with a flick
nudges it off his pads to long leg
dabs a back of a length delivery to point, after being squared up by the away movement
shortish and outside off, cuts to deep third man
hops around, surprised by the seam movement into him off back of a length, and just about protects his stumps
whacks a short ball outside off back down the pitch.
walks down the pitch to defend a short of a length delivery on off stump
legcutter, pitching very close to yorker-length, de Silva chops his bat on it and sends it to cover
length, opens the face to backward point. Starts off for a run and is sent back
legbreak, on a length, flicked to midwicket
short, little bit of room, rocks back and punches it through cover and point
full on middle, clipped to midwicket
length outside off, punched down to long-off
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-on
full, straightens around the fifth-stump channel, swings and misses

taps a fuller one to mid-on off the inside of the bat and takes off for a run. Rashid runs forward and dives as he hurls the throw towards the non-striker's end. Goes down awkwardly on his right shoulder. That's his bowling arm. And accompanied by a whiplash of the head as well. But he's fine
chipped over extra cover. Neat timing and the full face of the bat as he receives a gift of a length ball with ample room to swing the arms
blocks a length ball back to the bowler
chips it again, a leg cutter that messes up his timing, drops in no man's land with Afghan, the Afghan captain, running back from extra cover
short of a length on off, solidly blocked from the crease
length, spins away towards off, blocked with an open face to point
front foot out of the way as he drills a fullish one into the covers
turns it away behind square
zero turn, on a length outside off, beats the outside edge and misses the off stump as well
eases a fuller one to long-on off the front foot
full on middle, blocked
slower length ball on off, defended
shortish on off, pulled to midwicket
full on middle, launched straight over with sublime timing
length on middle, defended to point
opens up for a big cut and misses
full outside off, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
drifts it down the leg side, gets past the batsman's attempted flick and also past Shahzad's gloves to his right. No good from the keeper
defends this back
straight length ball, shifts back and punches wide of long-on
defends a flighted delivery into the leg side
going down leg as Tharanga stays back looking to flick this away and gets hit on the pad
turns sharply from a length on middle and he keeps it out from the crease

huge run out chance missed! Or wait. There has been a run out in one end, but they miss it at the other end. Deliberately pokes at a wide length ball and gets an outside edge to third man. There is miscommunication on the second run. Dhananjaya is at the same end as Tharanga who is very late in responding. They are nearly at the same end, but Shahzad has taken the bails off with Dhananjaya still nearing the crease. Shahzad completes the run out and then turns around and flicks the ball to the bowler's end where Naib makes a complete mess by running across and falling on the stumps before he can get his hands on it. That's the most convoluted sequence I have ever seen!
left alone outside off but the ball kicks up at Shahzad who fumbles
driven to sweeper cover
full outside off, driven to cover
short of length, opens the face to third man
pitched up on off, driven to cover
length, straightens and hits him too high as he misses the flick. Yup, too high
and the response: a full charge forward and driven imperiously through the covers where Rashid slides across to cut it off in the deep
length on middle, defended
advances and drills to long-on
comes down the track and blocks back
digs a yorker out from the crease
full outside off, driven crisply off the front foot through the covers
tries to cut with the ball nipping into him and makes no contact
again, opens up for a cut, straighter this time but still not enough room
full outside off, driven into the covers
full on the pads, flicked behind square
quicker dart, slid into off, punched through cover for a very quick one. Hesitation again but no problem in the end
pushed to cover for another quick single. Living on the edge
backs away and punches to long-off
full outside off, blocked
advances and pushes back

stays back and tries to flick, seems to have got an inside edge onto the pad. But Afghanistan think otherwise and go for the review. Seemed to be going down leg as well. Okay, no bat, but that's heading miles down leg. Ok, not that far down, but enough to be missing leg. Review lost, and we have ourselves a drinks break
clips a short delivery off his hips to the left of mid-on
lets the ball come to him and gently gives it the directions to deep square leg
misses out as he goes for the pull against a slower short ball. It seems like he'ad ajusted his bat-swing but not to be
sneaks in an yorker that has Kusal playing all around it, the flick shot not making contact and the ball thudding into his pads
top edge over the keeper. Well, he was looking for a boundary with the pull shot and he, well, gets what he wants.
crashes the overpitched delivery outside off down to the long-on boundary. He puts a lot of bottom hand into the stroke, but it doesn't go all the way
steps out of his crease and plays for non-existent turn. So a drive to long-off ends up at long-on
shimmies down, playing the angle into him from round the wicket, and flicks to midwicket
hammers the slog sweep! Lovely shot selection, picking on the ball tossed up and well outside off, giving him the room the free the arms
flatter and outside off, carves it to deep point
taps a good length ball down the pitch, and it hits the non-striker, which is probably why Kusal doesn't want to take a run
nudges to long-on
appeal for lbw but the legbreak pitches on leg stump and spins further, giving it no chance of hitting the stumps. Heck, Tharanga can't even get bat to it
skids through with the angle from over the wicket, Kusal dabs into the off side
googly - dipping sharply into the block hole - Kusal backs away and jams a straight bat down on it for a single to mid-off
full on off stump, pushes to long-off

premeditates the sweep and gets bowled! It's too full to play across the line like that and he basically ends up yorking himself. Rashid has a wicket in his first over. The sun rises in the east. And I'm always broke.
googly first up, which Mathews doesn't quite pick, playing a cover drive and getting an inside edge through square leg. Geez, the dip he gets with that ball!
another yorker from Gulbadin - he's pretty good with those. Tharanga just about digs it out

taken at mid-off! And Naib poses for the cameras, showing off his biceps, and a big broad smile too. Tharanga, after struggling through new-ball swing, after being part of a terrible mix-up that led to the run-out of his partner, throws his wicket away by lifting a length ball on middle and off straight into Asghar Afghan's hands
full and outside off, pushes to mid-off
full and outside off, drives to mid-off
leaps up to cut this short and wide delivery out to deep third man
searches for a run at midwicket, closing the bat face a touch too early and getting a leading edge to cover. Mathews wants a single but it's not there
presses forward to drive the legbreak to long-off
loopy delivery on off stump - possibly a googly - Mathews drills it to long-off
googly, flatter in trajectory, pitching on off stump and getting a backfoot defence in response
skids under the bat as the quicker delivery - at 100 kph - beats Jayasuriya's inside edge. This, by the way, is the legbreak
they're appealing for a catch, hoping the ball - having been flicked by Jayasuriya - bounces off the boot and into Rashid's hands. Umpire Brathwaite says no. He's perfectly right
full on leg stump, works it to deep midwicket
pulls the short ball outside off to midwicket. Nine balls at the crease, and plenty of shots played. Living up to the name
full and outside of, Jayasuriya defends to point
on the pads, he flicks it away to long leg
tucks a back of a length delivery outside off to midwicket
excellent slower ball, finishing around off stump, almost from the back of the hand. Jayasuriya picks it and blocks to point for a single
another slower ball outside off, Mathews drives to cover
width on offer and Jayasuriya flays it to sweeper cover
seems like a googly but it's overpitched outside off. Mathews smears it to long-off
risky playing so far back to a fullish delivery, which is also on target. Just about gets bat to it, playing a late cut, and the slip fielder moves quickly to his right to stop the runs
turns it to midwicket
backs away and punches a length ball to cover
goes round the wicket for a full delivery on off stump. Jayasuriya whips it to midwicket
turns a flighted delivery from round the wicket towards midwicket.
jumps back and punches a flatter delivery outside off to long-on
good length, outside off, pushes to cover
slingy action from Nabi this time, getting a good length ball to slide into the left-hander from round the stumps. Jayasuriya taps it to long-on
shortish on leg stump, turns it to short fine leg
uses the straight bat to punch a quick and flat delivery to midwicket
floated up outside off, driven through the covers. 100 up now but a long, long way to go

huge shout for lbw, not given by umpire Gregory Brathwaite. No reviews left. Rashid floats this up on middle stump and Shehan misses with the sweep. Seems like it would have gone onto smash middle stump
googly, tucked to midwicket
clips a fuller one to deep midwicket. They run the first two alright, and then there's miscommunication on the third. All good in the end
short of a length outside off, punched towards mid-off
punches a length ball to midwicket
short of length, tucked to midwicket
turns it away to square leg
tries to clip a fuller one and wears it on the pad
slides in and finds the inside of the bat to midwicket
tries to cut one that slides into him and gets an inside edge. Lucky to have not chopped on

clips a fuller one off the pads to midwicket, and oh dear, what's happening here! Utter chaos. Serious lack of communication. And this seems to be Mathews' fault. Says yes, comes down a few steps and then changes mind all of a sudden, leaving Shehan in the middle of nowhere. Awful, awful cricket
googly, spins in on middle and leg, tucked to deep midwicket
comes forward to drive and gets beaten as it goes on with the arm
length ball on middle, drilled back
punched to long-on
turns this away to midwicket
full on middle, Mathews is looking for a flick, but ends up giving a leading edge into the covers
full on middle, drives to mid-on
back of a length, punches to cover
slower ball, dipping on middle, Mathews turns it away to midwicket
pulls the short ball away to deep square leg
shortish on leg stump, works to midwicket
full on off stump, blocks and runs to cover
full on off stump, drives back at the bowler
good length on off stump, blocks. The flatter trajectory just does not let batsmen get under him
blocks a quicker delivery on off stump
turns a full delivery on middle, with the angle, to long-on
looks like a legbreak - which doesn't really turn any way. Ends up sitting up to be smacked to long-off
works it off the top of middle and leg to deep square leg
keeps a touch low as Mathews defends outside off
steps out, making the room he needs to access the off side, and cracks the ball through cover
full on middle, pushes towards long-on. Shenwari cuts across from midwicket, diving to his right and getting a direct hiat the bowler's end as well
sensational shot - the front foot not going too far forward so he can unleash a full bat-swing, flicking the straight ball away to the leg of midwicket
shortish on off stump, blocks
nearly lbw! Thisara plants his front leg across his stumps and the quick legbreak nearly traps him. As such, an inside edge results to midwicket
full on leg stump, works it away to long-on
full toss outside off, Mathews swats it to long-on
leading edge as Thisara is drawn forward with a flick shot. Rashid bowling over the wicket tricks the left-hander with the googly
that's almost seam-up - at 99 kph - which Thisara blocks in front of middle
smooth drive to long-on
poor bowling - bouncer down leg with fine leg up inside the circle. Thisara uses that gaffe and pulls the ball to the boundary. Naib immediately asks the fielder to go back
nudges the back of a length delivery to square leg
full on leg stump, whips it to deep square leg
lifts a slower ball to long-on with a proper whirl of his wrists
works the full toss outside off to long-on. That's drinks
dinks the googly off his pads towards fine leg. More hesitation in the running with Thisara thinking there's two, but Mathews yelling no. He's right this time
whips a legbreak on the pads away to the fine leg boundary. First four off his bowling, in the sixth over
tossed up googly, Thisara defends
works overtime with his wrists to send a ball on the pads away to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle, Mathews blocks
goes back against the googly and pushes towards midwicket
backs away and cuts the short of a length delivery to the sweeper
flicks a full ball on off stump to deep square leg
defends a good length ball - from a round arm action - on off stump
very quick, on the pads, Thisara calmly puts it at long-on
good length, outside off, glides it to backward point

taken at long-on! Rashid's the man under the ball again. And he comes into play with Mathews trying to break the shackles, coming down the track against Nabi and launching him down the ground. Gets too close to the ball, has no leverage to bring his power game into play
clips a fuller one to midwicket
shifts back to a length ball and defends
bowled him! That's the legbreak, except it's the wrong'un and comes on like an offbreak. Shanaka has no clue about it, ball beats inside edge and takes out middle stump
draws him forward with a good length and spins it past his outside edge
slides onto leg side, turned away to midwicket
length, punched crisply through the covers
length on off, blocked
slides in and hits the pad before rolling away towards short third man
presses forward and finds the inside of the bat to midwicket
length on middle, defended back
cuts from too close to the body and gets an outside edge to third man
back of a length, punched to wide long-off
back of a length, punched back
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover
spins away and he blocks off the outside of the bat
slides into the and deflects off it to short fine leg
short, spins away, cut to sweeper cover
driven to long-off
length on middle, defended back
comes down the track and swipes ambitiously. Ball gets a peek between bat and pad, gleefully accepts it and goes past the inside edge to clatter into the stumps
slows it up and bowls full on middle, blocked
length outside off, defended
full on middle, blocked
pushes with an open face through backward point
short, spins in, cut to cover
jabs a length ball back
backs away and shovels this wide of long-on
googly, defended
opens the face to third man for a quick one
full, driven to sweeper cover
left alone outside off

Thisara goes, Sri Lanka's last recognised batsman. But, umm, this game's looked done for a while now. Thisara swings at this short of a length delivery, makes no contact as the ball crashes into middle stump
short, ducked under
short, goes over leg stump as he ducks
short, ducked under
slower length ball, opens the face to point
length, sliding towards middle, pushed through covers
Rashid seals it with a googly. Beats the sweep after landing on a length and pins him in front of middle
